titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory to the Robert D. Burhans papers

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2018-02-27T09:27-0800

change.item: Revised to include boxes 35-37, which contain contents of envelope mJ. - Paige Davenport
Materials rehoused and container list updated
PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::Robert D. Burhans Papers)//EN" "burhansr.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

did.abstract: Materials relating to activities of the First Special Service Force ("Devil's Brigade") and the 474th Infantry Regiment during World War II including correspondence, field orders, directives, reports, regulations, handbooks, maps, and photographs. Used as research material for the book by R. D. Burhans, The First Special Service Force: A War History of the North Americans, 1942-1944 (Washington, D.C., 1947).

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Robert D. Burhans papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Colonel, United States Army; member, First Special Service Force, during World War II.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Materials relating to activities of the First Special Service Force ("Devil's Brigade") and the 474th Infantry Regiment during World War II including correspondence, field orders, directives, reports, regulations, handbooks, maps, and photographs. Used as research material for the book by R. D. Burhans, The First Special Service Force: A War History of the North Americans, 1942-1944 (Washington, D.C., 1947).

did.unittitle: Handbook for military government in Germany
Secret telegrams, Amchitka '43, also journal of orders, incidents, etc...
Field Orders, First Special Service Force (FSSF) Part I
Field Order #1, Landing Force 16.8 secret security
Booklet prescribing clothing, equipment and ammunition, FFSF,
Awards, requests for officers, movement orders,
FSSF - Special list of clothing and equipment S.24,
Operation plan no. 4-43 Task Force 16 Adak, Alaska.
Organization Table of Organization and Equipment,
Captured enemy field order, South France,
FSSF Kiska Field Order 5, Landing Force 16.8,
FSSF History (for possible use in history).
Third U.S. Army Administrative order #2 and changes 1 to 10,
Reorganization A.R. Force Table of Organization and Equipment,
Table of Organization and Equipment, Infantry regiment,
FSSF G O #8, 9, documentary evidence, GO #10 evidence,
FSSF Original Table of Organization and Equipment,
Bulletin of judge advocate general of the Army,
FSSF tentative tables of organization, Combat echelon, N19, 1942.
Head Quarters, Allied Land Forces, Norway, telephone directory
German People's Army with secret addenda,
Fifth Army History, II, 115 p., III 135 p., undated
S-3 Field Orders no. 1 to no. 28
Message Books. M-210 Signal Corps U.S. Army,
Surgeons' reports, action at Mt. La Difensa Italy,
Southern France, Prince Henry Loading Plan,
Movement Orders Secret Travel Orders, U.S. to Italy,
S-3 Journal, Southern France, circa 1 Oct-28 Nov 1944,
Anzio, Rome Field Operations Periodic Reports,
Intelligence Summaries of Enemy Operations, Central Europe and Norway,
FSSF Organizational Chart and Personnel Orders and Regulations
Printed matter: U.S. Army Handbooks, Pamphlets, News Clippings
Correspondence relating to publication of book
Negatives (3x5) and Contact Prints in labelled negative jackets relating to the activities of the FSSF
Intelligence Reports Circulation 1st Special Service Force
Gazetteer of Western Germany Map Series
Tactics of the German Army and How to Defeat Them
Office of Prodaction Management, Springfield, Mass, A.D. Dickinson,
Force History-Awards, Notes on Personal Experiences, La Difensa, Mt Majo, etc.,
Notes on Geographical Section General Staff Maps
Printed Matter, The Saturday Evening Post,
General Frederick file, task file "B" and miscellaneous plans
Notes on Geographical Section General Staff Maps of Germany,
1000 4"x5" and 35 mm negatives of photos showing the activities of the First Special Service Force and the 474th Infantry during World War II in Europe,

4 portrait photos of Major General Robert T. Frederick and others; 45 prints of the 474th Infantry in Normandy and Norway; 107 prints of the 474th Infantry at award formations, parades, and social events; 330 prints of combat scenes involving the 474th Infantry; 98 prints of the First Special Service Force in Italy and Southern France; and 87 unidentified aerial photographs,
100 aerial photos of Kiska Island (Aleutians), M. La difensa (Italy), M. La Remetanea (Italy), and M. Maggiore (Italy),

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Formerly envelope mJ. Includes unidentified photos.

did.unittitle: 103 prints of the First Special Service Force in Italy,

scopecontent.p: Includes 1 print of the 474th Infantry in Norway.
